title: Fair Skin Tone
text: Fair skin often has pink or neutral undertones and burns easily in the sun. Best suited for light foundation shades like Porcelain, Ivory, and Vanilla.

title: Light Skin Tone
text: Light skin has slightly more warmth than fair tones and tans a little. Ideal foundation matches include Warm Ivory, Nude, and Light Beige.

title: Medium Skin Tone
text: Medium skin has balanced pigmentation and tans easily. Works best with foundation shades like Sand, Honey, and Natural Beige.

title: Tan Skin Tone
text: Tan skin features golden or olive undertones and rarely burns. Recommended shades include Caramel, Golden, and Warm Tan.

title: Deep Skin Tone
text: Deep skin has rich pigmentation with red, blue, or golden undertones. Best foundation shades include Chestnut, Espresso, and Cocoa.

title: Cool Undertone
text: Cool undertones show bluish veins and suit silver jewelry. Best makeup colors include pink, rose, and neutral-cool tones.

title: Warm Undertone
text: Warm undertones show greenish veins and look best with gold jewelry. Choose foundation and blush with golden or peach hues.

title: Neutral Undertone
text: Neutral undertones show a balance of blue and green veins. They can wear both cool and warm shades comfortably.

title: Oval Face Shape
text: Oval faces suit most makeup styles. Apply contour to the sides of the forehead and blush on the apples of the cheeks.

title: Round Face Shape
text: Round faces benefit from elongating contour along the sides and jawline. Apply blush slightly above the apples to lift the cheeks.

title: Square Face Shape
text: Contour along the jawline and temples to soften edges. Highlight the nose bridge and under eyes for balance.

title: Heart Face Shape
text: Heart-shaped faces look balanced with contour on the temples and chin. Apply blush just below the cheekbones.

title: Long Face Shape
text: Contour forehead and chin to shorten the appearance. Apply blush horizontally to create width.

title: Monolid Eye Shape
text: Use gradient eyeshadow with shimmer in the center. A thin liner enhances the lash line without overpowering the lid.

title: Hooded Eyes
text: Apply matte shades above the crease to open the eyes. Use a thin eyeliner and lift the outer corner slightly.

title: Almond Eyes
text: Most versatile shape for makeup. Symmetrical smokey eyes or cat eyeliner enhances their natural balance.

title: Round Eyes
text: Use darker shadows at the outer corners to elongate. Avoid thick liner on the lower lash to keep eyes open.

title: Downturned Eyes
text: Create an upward flick with liner to lift the eyes. Focus mascara on the outer lashes for an instant lift.

title: Fair Skin Lip Shades
text: Soft pinks, corals, and mauves flatter fair skin tones. Avoid overly dark shades that can appear harsh.

title: Medium Skin Lip Shades
text: Berry, terracotta, and warm nudes look natural on medium tones. Plum adds elegance for evening looks.

title: Tan Skin Lip Shades
text: Deep rose, copper, and chestnut tones enhance tan skin beautifully. Brick red works well for parties.

title: Deep Skin Lip Shades
text: Rich burgundy, plum brown, and chocolate tones complement deep skin. Metallic shades add a glamorous touch.

title: Spring Makeup Look
text: Fresh and dewy look with peach, coral, and light green tones. Keep the base luminous and natural.

title: Summer Makeup Look
text: Soft, romantic shades like pink, lilac, and bronze dominate. Lightweight foundation keeps skin glowing.

title: Autumn Makeup Look
text: Use earthy colors like rust, amber, and gold. Matte finishes and warm tones suit fall lighting.

title: Winter Makeup Look
text: Bold glam with navy, wine, and silver accents. Matte lips and shimmer eyes complete the holiday look.

title: Office Makeup Look
text: Go for matte foundation, neutral eyeshadow, and nude gloss. Keep the overall finish natural and polished.

title: Evening Party Look
text: Use satin foundation, smokey eyes, and bold lips like red or plum. Add subtle highlighter for glow.

title: Bridal Look
text: Opt for full coverage foundation, soft shimmer eyes, and rose lips. Setting spray ensures long wear.

title: Photoshoot Look
text: HD matte base and precise contouring create a flawless effect. Avoid SPF to prevent white cast under lights.

title: Outdoor Casual Look
text: Use BB cream, waterproof mascara, and tinted lip balm. Lightweight formulas help skin breathe.

title: Pre-Makeup Cleansing
text: Use a gentle foaming cleanser to remove oil and dirt before applying any base product.

title: Toning Step
text: Apply toner to balance pH and refresh skin. Rose water or witch hazel works well for all types.

title: Moisturizing
text: Hydrate with a moisturizer containing hyaluronic acid for smoother makeup application.

title: Primer Use
text: Apply primer to fill pores and control shine. Silicone-based primers give a smooth finish.

title: Sun Protection
text: Finish prep with broad-spectrum SPF to protect against UV damage before makeup.

title: Foundation by Skin Type
text: Dry skin suits dewy foundation, oily skin prefers matte formulas, and sensitive skin benefits from mineral bases.

title: Concealer by Skin Type
text: Cream concealers hydrate dry skin, while matte liquids work better for oily types.

title: Blush Type Match
text: Cream blush suits dry skin; powder blush controls oil; non-comedogenic types fit sensitive skin.

title: Setting Product Choice
text: Use cream-based setting for dry skin, loose powder for oily, and micronized powders for sensitive types.

title: Longer Lipstick Wear
text: Blot lips with tissue and reapply a thin layer for longer staying power.

title: Bright Under Eyes
text: Apply a peach corrector before concealer to neutralize dark circles.

title: Smudge-Free Mascara
text: Set under-eye area with powder to prevent mascara transfer.

title: Instant Glow Trick
text: Mix a drop of liquid highlighter with foundation for a dewy finish.

title: Quick Eye Lift
text: Apply concealer upward from outer eye corners for an instant lifted look.
